dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c & b Vettori 87 (103b 9x4 0x6 148m) SR: 84.46

dismissalComment.html: smart catch! Vettori teases him with the length, inviting him into a drive, de Villiers uses his feet and hits it hard back over Vettori's head, but he nonchalantly sticks his right hand up and intercepts it excellently. Good reflexes to end a fine innings from de Villiers

dismissalComment.html: good grief, he's bowled him! MIlls pitches full and the ball holds its line, nipping through van Wyk's loose defense, easy as pie, just sneaking back and knocking back off stump! Mills strikes in just the first over as the replacement opener makes no impact today

dismissalComment.html: edged and caught at first slip! Mills continues his magic, hitting the deck at an uncomfortable height, squaring up Kallis who fends at it and loops up a simple catch to Taylor

headshotImage.longCaption: Shaun Pollock player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught! Pollock biffs Mills back over his head, making room, but doesn't get enough on it as Taylor runs across and pouches it at long-off! Mills must be a relieved man, given how tense that ODI got during South Africa's last tour of New Zealand. He gets a third wicket

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: spectacular catch! Morkel flashes at a short delivery, cramped for room, and gets a thick outside edge that flies low and hard to McCullum's left, but he times his dive to perfection and snaps it up, one-handed, an inch off the ground! He's cock-a-hoop after that, and why not?

dismissalComment.html: he gets another! Good length outside off stump, Botha fetches it and mistimes the slog out to Vincent at long-on, who punches the air on completion of that catch

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Martin b Styris 44 (64b 4x4 0x6 117m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: 0h, well caught Martin! Smith gets a rank long hop and pulls over midwicket, rather poorly as he struggled to time the shot, and the fielder on the ropes gets low to his left and cups a good catch, sliding to his knees an inch inside the boundary. Its awfully close, even as Martin smiles and runs in. The catch is referred to the third umpire, and after a long time the decision is that his back leg did not brush the boundary demarcation. Now that was a tough, tough call to make. It looked very close. So Smith has to go for 44. Boy, he's fuming at himself. Out to a long hop.

commentPreTextItems.html: One ball left. South Africa cannot lose. Nel asks Boucher what to do. The dressing room rises. Oh, Mark Gillespie. He runs in and holds up at the stumps as Boucher advances early. Gillespie warns him and the crowd boos.

commentTextItems.html: Andre Nel is a hero under starry Durban tonight! What a gem! Third ball in a row, he makes room and drills a full delivery through point and the South Africans erupt! South win by two wickets off the final ball and New Zealand's horror tour continues!

commentPostTextItems.html: How costly did that drop turn out to be? Nel clubs two fours off three balls to give South Africa the tightest of wins. Absolutely nerve-wracking. Vettori looks ticked off something fierce as he lopes off. Gillespie looks gutted. Mills bowled to so well to nip out two at the start and three at the end, his first five-for in ODIs, but Gillespie has let his side down with two poor last overs. South Africa take a 1-0 lead in the best-of-three series. Whew, what a cracker that turned out to be.
New Zealand must just want to catch the next flight out of Durban. Tough series for Vettori to digest. They cant win a game.
AB de Villiers receives the Man-of-the-Match award for his 87. "Nella, you little beauty," he says.

Well I hope you've enjoyed this match as much as I have. Thanks for tuning in to Cricinfo again. This is Jamie Alter, your commentator, signing off on behalf of all of us here. Do come back and join us for the second ODI, at Port Elizabeth on November 30. Its a 14:30 local, 12:30 GMT start. Bye for now!

commentTextItems.html: Andre Nel! He's literally smoked that! Its full again and he drills it through extra cover, who had no chance, and the game is tied! Would you believe this?

commentPreTextItems.html: Now the home side look  tense in the dressing room

commentTextItems.html: oh he's absolutely nailed that! Nel! Makes room and drives a full delivery in the blockhole through extra cover and Durban cheers like there's no tomorrow
good bowling, fullish and Boucher swings across the line, picking up an inside-edge that gets Nel back on strike
dropped! Nel slashes a full and wide delivery up and over backward point, a fielder runs after at is it dies on him, diving out in front and failing to hold on! Very tough catch

commentPreTextItems.html: Top over from Mills. The last one coming up. Nel to face. 11 from 6. Gillespie to bowl over the stumps.

commentTextItems.html: big heave! Nel closes his eyes and gives it an almighty heave, missing by miles ... not wise from the big man

commentPreTextItems.html: Boucher crossed, so he's back on strike. Andre Nel at the other end. Here's Mills.

commentTextItems.html: slides down leg stump, Boucher walks across and tries to paddle, misses, sets off, McCullum has a shy back to the stumps but misses as Boucher dives full length to get back in ... would've been out had he hit!

full outside off stump, Boucher swings wildly and mistimes it off the toe and of the bat, then runs one to third man
tries to get cheeky, stepping outside off and going for the paddle but Mills chases it him and the ball balloon up off his shoulder to gully

commentPreTextItems.html: The South Africans have a laugh in the dressing room. Pretty calm bunch. A new bat comes out.

commentTextItems.html: slower ball, fullish outside off stump, Botha swats it over mid-on and it falls between two men in the deep, Boucher sprints through very well

commentPreTextItems.html: Mills looks to be the man  for the job. 16 from 12.

commentTextItems.html: hah! He drives a full delivery from the crease, losing the bat from his grip, it slips up and thuds into midwicket, splicing into two pieces, but Boucher runs one
good stop, as Botha kneels down and paddles another low full toss on leg stump around the corner, but fine leg, up in the circle, dives and takes some pace off the ball

commentTextItems.html: another full toss, this time Boucher swivels around and mistimes it nto the gap at square leg, that could've gone anywhere!
strays down leg stump, a full toss, rubbish ball, and Boucher punishes it with a flick down to fine leg
full outside leg stump, clipped through midwicket for one
yorker outside off stump, he reaches out and squeezes one to gully

commentPreTextItems.html: Gillespie comes on, around the stumps. Third man and fine leg up. Cow corner in place.

commentTextItems.html: full on leg stump, clipped through midwicket and they sprint two, well run

commentPreTextItems.html: Johan Botha's the new batsman. Hero from the other night.

commentTextItems.html: good ball, shaping away from him as he has a flirt, there's a noise, possibly pad, McCullum collects and asks the question but the umpire says nope

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Martin b Styris 44 (64b 4x4 0x6 117m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: 0h, well caught Martin! Smith gets a rank long hop and pulls over midwicket, rather poorly as he struggled to time the shot, and the fielder on the ropes gets low to his left and cups a good catch, sliding to his knees an inch inside the boundary. Its awfully close, even as Martin smiles and runs in. The catch is referred to the third umpire, and after a long time the decision is that his back leg did not brush the boundary demarcation. Now that was a tough, tough call to make. It looked very close. So Smith has to go for 44. Boy, he's fuming at himself. Out to a long hop.

dismissalText.commentary: Morne van Wyk b Mills 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: good grief, he's bowled him! MIlls pitches full and the ball holds its line, nipping through van Wyk's loose defense, easy as pie, just sneaking back and knocking back off stump! Mills strikes in just the first over as the replacement opener makes no impact today

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis c Taylor b Mills 1 (15b 0x4 0x6 20m) SR: 6.66

dismissalComment.html: edged and caught at first slip! Mills continues his magic, hitting the deck at an uncomfortable height, squaring up Kallis who fends at it and loops up a simple catch to Taylor

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Martin b Styris 44 (64b 4x4 0x6 117m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: 0h, well caught Martin! Smith gets a rank long hop and pulls over midwicket, rather poorly as he struggled to time the shot, and the fielder on the ropes gets low to his left and cups a good catch, sliding to his knees an inch inside the boundary. Its awfully close, even as Martin smiles and runs in. The catch is referred to the third umpire, and after a long time the decision is that his back leg did not brush the boundary demarcation. Now that was a tough, tough call to make. It looked very close. So Smith has to go for 44. Boy, he's fuming at himself. Out to a long hop.

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c & b Vettori 87 (103b 9x4 0x6 148m) SR: 84.46

dismissalComment.html: smart catch! Vettori teases him with the length, inviting him into a drive, de Villiers uses his feet and hits it hard back over Vettori's head, but he nonchalantly sticks his right hand up and intercepts it excellently. Good reflexes to end a fine innings from de Villiers

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c sub (JS Patel) b Martin 46 (59b 3x4 1x6 85m) SR: 77.96

dismissalComment.html: yes he can! Martin pitches very short, Duminy goes for a hurried pull, the ball gaining on him and catching the splice of the bat, spooning out to midwicket where Patel, the sub, takes a simple enough catch

dismissalText.commentary: Shaun Pollock c Taylor b Mills 6 (5b 1x4 0x6 7m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: caught! Pollock biffs Mills back over his head, making room, but doesn't get enough on it as Taylor runs across and pouches it at long-off! Mills must be a relieved man, given how tense that ODI got during South Africa's last tour of New Zealand. He gets a third wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Albie Morkel c †McCullum b Mills 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: spectacular catch! Morkel flashes at a short delivery, cramped for room, and gets a thick outside edge that flies low and hard to McCullum's left, but he times his dive to perfection and snaps it up, one-handed, an inch off the ground! He's cock-a-hoop after that, and why not?
